results.title: Beginnings - Inspiration - the Role of the Writer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Writers on Writing”.
This series is based on a growing archive of video material of conversations between contemporary writers discussing their work. The material has been re-edited to form a resource for students and teachers of English, and each of the six twenty-minute videos focuses on different aspects and stages of the writing process. Each video is accompanied by a resource booklet. In this video, writers talk about how they began to write, what their inspiration is and their perception of the writer’s role.

results.title: Beginning wheel techniques
results.brief_description: An introduction to the fundamentals of pottery. Wheel throwing is simplified by using the clock dial as a means of reference. Techniques shown making a cylinder are sticking, mastering, centering, opening, raising and finishing. The potter’s rib is demonstrated. The needle point tool is used to level and to test for centre bottom thickness. Similar techniques are shown for bowl and plate forms.

results.title: Beginning tumbling
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tumbling”.
By regular and slow-motion demonstration, accompanied by a simple explanatory commentary, the following tumbling starts are taught: forward roll, dive to forward roll, three men sideward roll, stand, hand walk, cartwheel, round-off and combinations.

results.title: Beginning swimming
results.creator_credit: Jorhal Pictures and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Land and water drills are used in demonstrating basic techniques of swimming for beginners. Includes demonstrations of the crawl stroke, breast stroke, back stroke and back float. Shows how kicking, breathing, floating, paddling, stroking and pulling with the arm are co-ordinated in the American crawl.

results.title: Beginning reading
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Stephen Skok
results.brief_description: Showns an innovative method of teaching reading based on the Victorian Education Department’s booklet “Beginning reading”. Shows how to develop awareness of semantics, syntax and letter-sound relationships through shared linguistic and reading experiences, personalised writing and a positive attitude towards print.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Stephen Skok

results.title: Beginning of life
results.brief_description: Scientists study nature and experiment to discover the basis of evolution. By tracing the history of the element carbon, the evolution of organic matter from cosmic matter to unicellular and multi-cellular organisms is known. Experiments synthesizing complex organic matter from simple substances prove the importance of carbon in the evolution of life; amino acids can be synthesized which are linked with proteins and important to life. No credits available.

results.title: Beginning of history
results.creator_credit: Graham Wallace and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: By using the remains of things made and built by prehistoric man to reconstruct a prehistoric dwelling, this film ambitiously attempts to tell the story of what happened in the ages before the period at which most history books begin. The co-operation of many world famous British museums, societies, and foundations has helped to make this reconstruction, (especially the Iron Age farm), authentic. No credits available.

results.title: Beginning (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Merry-Go-Round Sex Education. - Part 1.”.
The first in a three part series of sex-education films for young children, “Beginning” uses cross references in the animal world to explain embryonic growth and development. A microscope shows the process of cell division in the egg, and animated drawings reveal the embryo’s position in the body. Method of nourishment, and developmental changes to five months.

results.title: Beginners please
results.creator_credit: Exclusive Films, Gaumont-British Instructional, BFI and Donald Carter
results.brief_description: All physical training must be begun gently; gymnastics should be started with light excerises. This film demonstrates games designed to ease the muscles before going on to more strenuous and involved movements.
